conclusion: Analyze the graph of the reciprocal of velocity as a function of displacement to determine acceleration or deceleration.
The x-axis represents displacement x and the y-axis represents the reciprocal of velocity, 1/v.
If velocity v is increasing, 1/v will decrease; if v is decreasing, 1/v will increase.
The slope of the graph 1/v vs. x can determine if 1/v is increasing or decreasing.
The line in the graph has a positive slope, indicating 1/v increases as x increases.
Since 1/v is increasing, velocity v must be decreasing.
If velocity v is decreasing, the particle is decelerating.
